s.text: It's as if, having lost the Melfi method of making Tony seem human, the writers have struck on another way to do it: play him off someone really angry and crazy, so that the Soprano MO comes off as sanity itself.

It's as if, having lost the Melfi method of making Tony seem human, the writers have struck on another way to do it: play him off someone really angry and crazy, so that the Soprano MO comes off as sanity itself.
Which strikes me as an excellent way to solve the Livia problem.

Or the black preacher on the take, whom we meet in Episode 2 of this season?
Here's why I did the right thing in hiring you as a TV critic--and why I'll let you live, for now: You understood Christopher better than I did.
He appears in Episode 2, and by Episode 3, he's jumpstarted the season.
